import plotly.express as px


fig = px.scatter(df, x="principal component 1", y="principal component 2", log_x=True, color = y_kmeans,
                 hover_name="artists", hover_data=["popularity", "tempo"])

fig.show()
source.12a54bc3:
import scipy.cluster.hierarchy as sch
dendrogram = sch.dendrogram(sch.linkage(principalComponents1, method = 'ward'))
plt.title('Dendrogram')
plt.xlabel('Compounds')
plt.ylabel('Euclidean distances')
plt.show()

from sklearn.cluster import AgglomerativeClustering
hc2 = AgglomerativeClustering(n_clusters = 100, affinity = 'euclidean', linkage = 'ward')
y_hc2 = hc2.fit_predict(principalComponents1)

source.2645adad: In this notebook, I try to cluster popular songs on spotify using the musical features available in the dataset. The two clustering methods I used were KMeans and Agglomerative Hierarchical Clustering.
source.a4951ae9: # KMeans versus Hierarhical on Popular Songs Dataset
